apikey.description: API Key to use for API authentication. The only valid authentication mechanism for the Elasticsearch Service.

endpoint.description: Endpoint where the terraform provider will point to. Defaults to "https://api.elastic-cloud.com".

insecure.description: Allow the provider to skip TLS validation on its outgoing HTTP calls.

password.description: Password to use for API authentication. Available only when targeting ECE Installations or Elasticsearch Service Private.

timeout.description: Timeout used for individual HTTP calls. Defaults to "1m".

username.description: Username to use for API authentication. Available only when targeting ECE Installations or Elasticsearch Service Private.

verbose.description: When set, a "request.log" file will be written with all outgoing HTTP requests. Defaults to "false".

verbose_credentials.description: When set with verbose, the contents of the Authorization header will not be redacted. Defaults to "false".

verbose_file.description: Timeout used for individual HTTP calls. Defaults to "1m".

alias.description: Deployment alias, affects the format of the resource URLs.

debug_enabled.description: Optionally enable debug mode for APM servers - defaults to false

docker_image.description: Optionally override the docker image the APM nodes will use. This option will not work in ESS customers and should only be changed if you know what you're doing.

user_settings_json.description: An arbitrary JSON object allowing (non-admin) cluster owners to set their parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_yaml' is allowed), provided they are on the whitelist ('user_settings_whitelist') and not on the blacklist ('user_settings_blacklist'). (This field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

user_settings_override_json.description: An arbitrary JSON object allowing ECE admins owners to set clusters' parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_override_yaml' is allowed), ie in addition to the documented 'system_settings'. (This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of resource settings)

user_settings_override_yaml.description: An arbitrary YAML object allowing ECE admins owners to set clusters' parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_override_json' is allowed), ie in addition to the documented 'system_settings'. (This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of resource settings)

user_settings_yaml.description: An arbitrary YAML object allowing (non-admin) cluster owners to set their parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_json' is allowed), provided they are on the whitelist ('user_settings_whitelist') and not on the blacklist ('user_settings_blacklist'). (These field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

config.description: Optionally define the Apm configuration options for the APM Server

apm.description: **DEPRECATED** APM cluster definition. This should only be used for deployments running a version lower than 8.0

deployment_template_id.description: Deployment template identifier to create the deployment from. See the [full list](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/cloud/current/ec-regions-templates-instances.html) of regions and deployment templates available in ESS.

autoscale.description: Enable or disable autoscaling. Defaults to the setting coming from the deployment template.

cloud_id.description: The encoded Elasticsearch credentials to use in Beats or Logstash

max_size.description: Maximum size value for the maximum autoscaling setting.

max_size_resource.description: Maximum resource type for the maximum autoscaling setting.

min_size.description: Minimum size value for the minimum autoscaling setting.

min_size_resource.description: Minimum resource type for the minimum autoscaling setting.

policy_override_json.description: Computed policy overrides set directly via the API or other clients.

autoscaling.description: Optional Elasticsearch autoscaling settings, such a maximum and minimum size and resources.

instance_configuration_id.description: Computed Instance Configuration ID of the topology element

node_roles.description: The computed list of node roles for the current topology element

node_type_data.description: The node type for the Elasticsearch Topology element (data node)

node_type_ingest.description: The node type for the Elasticsearch Topology element (ingest node)

node_type_master.description: The node type for the Elasticsearch Topology element (master node)

node_type_ml.description: The node type for the Elasticsearch Topology element (machine learning node)

size.description: Amount of "size_resource" per node in the "<size in GB>g" notation

zone_count.description: Number of zones that the Elasticsearch cluster will span. This is used to set HA

docker_image.description: Overrides the docker image the Elasticsearch nodes will use. Note that this field will only work for internal users only.

plugins.description: List of Elasticsearch supported plugins, which vary from version to version. Check the Stack Pack version to see which plugins are supported for each version. This is currently only available from the UI and [ecctl](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/ecctl/master/ecctl_stack_list.html)

config.description: Elasticsearch settings which will be applied to all topologies

max_size.description: Maximum size value for the maximum autoscaling setting.

max_size_resource.description: Maximum resource type for the maximum autoscaling setting.

min_size.description: Minimum size value for the minimum autoscaling setting.

zone_count.description: Number of zones that the Elasticsearch cluster will span. This is used to set HA

type.description: Extension type, only `bundle` or `plugin` are supported.

url.description: Bundle or plugin URL, the extension URL can be obtained from the `ec_deployment_extension.<name>.url` attribute or the API and cannot be a random HTTP address that is hosted elsewhere.

version.description: Elasticsearch compatibility version. Bundles should specify major or minor versions with wildcards, such as `7.*` or `*` but **plugins must use full version notation down to the patch level**, such as `7.10.1` and wildcards are not allowed.

extension.description: Optional Elasticsearch extensions such as custom bundles or plugins.

ref_id.description: A human readable reference for the Elasticsearch resource. The default value `main-elasticsearch` is recommended.

alias.description: Alias for this Cross Cluster Search binding

ref_id.description: Remote elasticsearch "ref_id", it is best left to the default value

skip_unavailable.description: If true, skip the cluster during search when disconnected

remote_cluster.description: Optional Elasticsearch remote clusters to configure for the Elasticsearch resource, can be set multiple times

repository_name.description: ECE snapshot repository name, from the '/platform/configuration/snapshots/repositories' endpoint

reference.description: Cluster snapshot reference repository settings, containing the repository name in ECE fashion

snapshot.description:
(ECE only) Snapshot configuration settings for an Elasticsearch cluster.

For ESS please use the [elasticstack_elasticsearch_snapshot_repository](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/elastic/elasticstack/latest/docs/resources/elasticsearch_snapshot_repository) resource from the [Elastic Stack terraform provider](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/elastic/elasticstack/latest).

snapshot_name.description: Name of the snapshot to restore. Use '__latest_success__' to get the most recent successful snapshot.

source_elasticsearch_cluster_id.description: ID of the Elasticsearch cluster that will be used as the source of the snapshot

snapshot_source.description: Restores data from a snapshot of another deployment. ~> **Note on behavior** The snapshot_source block will not be saved in the Terraform state due to its transient nature. This means that whenever the snapshot_source block is set, a snapshot will **always be restored**, unless removed before running terraform apply.

strategy.description: Configuration strategy type autodetect, grow_and_shrink, rolling_grow_and_shrink, rolling_all

trust_all.description: If true, all clusters in this account will by default be trusted and the `trust_allowlist` is ignored.

trust_allowlist.description: The list of clusters to trust. Only used when `trust_all` is false.

relationship_id.description: The ID of the external trust relationship.

trust_all.description: If true, all clusters in this account will by default be trusted and the `trust_allowlist` is ignored.

trust_allowlist.description: The list of clusters to trust. Only used when `trust_all` is false.

Importing a deployment will not import the elasticsearch_username or elasticsearch_password attributes.

elasticsearch_username.description: Username for authenticating to the Elasticsearch resource.

docker_image.description: Optionally override the docker image the Enterprise Search nodes will use. Note that this field will only work for internal users only.

(This field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

(This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of resource settings)

(This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of resource settings)

(These field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

config.description: Optionally define the Enterprise Search configuration options for the Enterprise Search Server

debug_enabled.description: Optionally enable debug mode for Integrations Server instances - defaults to false

docker_image.description: Optionally override the docker image the Integrations Server nodes will use. Note that this field will only work for internal users only.

(This field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

(This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of resource settings)

(This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of resource settings)

(These field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

config.description: Optionally define the Integrations Server configuration options for the IntegrationsServer Server

endpoints.description: URLs for the accessing the Fleet and APM API's within this Integrations Server resource.

integrations_server.description: Integrations Server cluster definition. Integrations Server replaces `apm` in Stack versions > 8.0

docker_image.description: Optionally override the docker image the Kibana nodes will use. Note that this field will only work for internal users only.

user_settings_json.description: An arbitrary JSON object allowing (non-admin) cluster owners to set their parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_yaml' is allowed), provided they are on the whitelist ('user_settings_whitelist') and not on the blacklist ('user_settings_blacklist'). (This field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

(This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of resource settings)

(This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of resource settings)

(These field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of resource settings)

config.description: Optionally define the Kibana configuration options for the Kibana Server

kibana.description:
Kibana cluster definition.

-> **Note on disabling Kibana** While optional it is recommended deployments specify a Kibana block, since not doing so might cause issues when modifying or upgrading the deployment.

observability.description: Observability settings that you can set to ship logs and metrics to a deployment. The target deployment can also be the current deployment itself by setting observability.deployment_id to `self`.

region.description: Elasticsearch Service (ESS) region where the deployment should be hosted. For Elastic Cloud Enterprise (ECE) installations, set to `"ece-region".

request_id.description: Request ID to set when you create the deployment. Use it only when previous attempts return an error and `request_id` is returned as part of the error.

reset_elasticsearch_password.description: Explicitly resets the elasticsearch_password when true

traffic_filter.description: List of traffic filters rule identifiers that will be applied to the deployment.

version.description:
Elastic Stack version to use for all of the deployment resources.

-> Read the [ESS stack version policy](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/cloud/current/ec-version-policy.html#ec-version-policy-available) to understand which versions are available.

block.description: Provides an Elastic Cloud deployment resource, which allows deployments to be created, updated, and deleted.

as_file.description: Indicates the the remote keystore setting should be stored as a file. The default is false, which stores the keystore setting as string when value is a plain string.

deployment_id.description: Deployment ID of the Deployment that holds the Elasticsearch cluster where the keystore setting will be written to.

setting_name.description: Name for the keystore setting, if the setting already exists in the Elasticsearch cluster, it will be overridden.

value.description: Value of this setting. This can either be a string or a JSON object that is stored as a JSON string in the keystore.

block.description: Provides an Elastic Cloud Deployment Elasticsearch keystore resource, which allows you to create and update Elasticsearch keystore settings. Elasticsearch keystore settings can be created and updated through this resource, **each resource represents a single Elasticsearch Keystore setting**. After adding a key and its secret value to the keystore, you can use the key in place of the secret value when you configure sensitive settings. ~> **Note on Elastic keystore settings** This resource offers weaker consistency guarantees and will not detect and update keystore setting values that have been modified outside of the scope of Terraform, usually referred to as _drift_. For example, consider the following scenario: 1. A keystore setting is created using this resource. 2. The keystore setting's value is modified to a different value using the Elasticsearch Service API. 3. Running terraform apply fails to detect the changes and does not update the keystore setting to the value defined in the terraform configuration. To force the keystore setting to the value it is configured to hold, you may want to taint the resource and force its recreation. Before you create Elasticsearch keystore settings, check the [official Elasticsearch keystore documentation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/master/elasticsearch-keystore.html) and the [Elastic Cloud specific documentation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/cloud/current/ec-configuring-keystore.html).

download_url.description: The URL to download the extension archive.

extension_type.description: Extension type. Must be `bundle` or `plugin`. A `bundle` will usually contain a dictionary or script, where a `plugin` is compiled from source.

file_hash.description: Hash value of the file. Triggers re-uploading the file on change.

file_path.description: Local file path to upload as the extension.

last_modified.description: The datatime the extension was last modified.

size.description: The size of the extension file in bytes.

url.description: The extension URL which will be used in the Elastic Cloud deployment plan.

version.description: Elastic stack version. A full version (e.g 8.7.0) should be set for plugins. A wildcard (e.g 8.*) may be used for bundles.

block.description:
Provides an Elastic Cloud extension resource, which allows extensions to be created, updated, and deleted.

  Extensions allow users of Elastic Cloud to use custom plugins, scripts, or dictionaries to enhance the core functionality of Elasticsearch. Before you install an extension, be sure to check out the supported and official [Elasticsearch plugins](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/index.html) already available.

  **Tip :** If you experience timeouts when uploading an extension through a slow network, you might need to increase the [timeout setting](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/elastic/ec/latest/docs#timeout).

include_by_default.description: Indicates that the ruleset should be automatically included in new deployments (Defaults to false)

region.description: Filter region, the ruleset can only be attached to deployments in the specific region

type.description: Type of the ruleset. It can be `ip`, `vpce`, `azure_private_endpoint`, or `gcp_private_service_connect_endpoint`

azure_endpoint_guid.description: Azure endpoint GUID. Only applicable when the ruleset type is set to `azure_private_endpoint`

azure_endpoint_name.description: Azure endpoint name. Only applicable when the ruleset type is set to `azure_private_endpoint`

source.description: Traffic filter source: IP address, CIDR mask, or VPC endpoint ID, **only required** when the type is not `azure_private_endpoint`

block.description: Set of rules, which the ruleset is made of.

Provides an Elastic Cloud traffic filter resource, which allows traffic filter rules to be created, updated, and deleted. Traffic filter rules are used to limit inbound traffic to deployment resources.

  ~> **Note on traffic filters** If you use traffic_filter on an ec_deployment, Terraform will manage the full set of traffic rules for the deployment, and treat additional traffic filters as drift. For this reason, traffic_filter cannot be mixed with the ec_deployment_traffic_filter_association resource for a given deployment.

deployment_id.description: Required deployment ID where the traffic filter will be associated

traffic_filter_id.description: Required traffic filter ruleset ID to tie to a deployment

block.description: Provides an Elastic Cloud traffic filter association resource, which allows traffic filter rules to be associated to an Elastic Cloud deployment outside of the control of Terraform. Associations can be created and deleted.

settings.description: An arbitrary JSON object containing the repository settings.

name.description: The name of the snapshot repository configuration.

access_key.description: An S3 access key. If set, the secret_key setting must also be specified. If unset, the client will use the instance or container role instead.

bucket.description: Name of the S3 bucket to use for snapshots.

endpoint.description: The S3 service endpoint to connect to. This defaults to s3.amazonaws.com but the AWS documentation lists alternative S3 endpoints. If you are using an S3-compatible service then you should set this to the services endpoint.

path_style_access.description: Whether to force the use of the path style access pattern. If true, the path style access pattern will be used. If false, the access pattern will be automatically determined by the AWS Java SDK (See AWS documentation for details). Defaults to false.

region.description: Allows specifying the signing region to use. Specifying this setting manually should not be necessary for most use cases. Generally, the SDK will correctly guess the signing region to use. It should be considered an expert level setting to support S3-compatible APIs that require v4 signatures and use a region other than the default us-east-1. Defaults to empty string which means that the SDK will try to automatically determine the correct signing region.

secret_key.description: An S3 secret key. If set, the access_key setting must also be specified.

server_side_encryption.description: When set to true files are encrypted on server side using AES256 algorithm. Defaults to false.

block.description:
Manages Elastic Cloud Enterprise snapshot repositories.

  ~> **This resource can only be used with Elastic Cloud Enterprise** For Elastic Cloud SaaS please use the [elasticstack_elasticsearch_snapshot_repository](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/elastic/elasticstack/latest/docs/resources/elasticsearch_snapshot_repository) resource from the [Elastic Stack terraform provider](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/elastic/elasticstack/latest).

domain_name.description: The domain name to used in when configuring a private hosted zone in the VPCE connection.

region.description: Region to retrieve the Private Link configuration for.

vpc_service_name.description: The VPC service name used to connect to the region.

zone_ids.description: The IDs of the availability zones hosting the VPC endpoints.

block.description: Use this data source to retrieve information about the AWS Private Link configuration for a given region. Further documentation on how to establish a PrivateLink connection can be found in the ESS [documentation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/cloud/current/ec-traffic-filtering-vpc.html).

domain_name.description: The domain name to used in when configuring a private hosted zone in the VNet connection.

region.description: Region to retrieve the Private Link configuration for.

service_alias.description: The service alias to establish a connection to.

block.description: Use this data source to retrieve information about the Azure Private Link configuration for a given region. Further documentation on how to establish a PrivateLink connection can be found in the ESS [documentation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/cloud/current/ec-traffic-filtering-vnet.html).

elasticsearch_cluster_ref_id.description: The locally-unique user-specified id of an APM Resource.

http_endpoint.description: HTTP endpoint for the APM resource.

https_endpoint.description: HTTPS endpoint for the APM resource.

ref_id.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for this APM resource.

instance_configuration_id.description: Controls the allocation of this topology element as well as allowed sizes and node_types. It needs to match the ID of an existing instance configuration.

size.description: Amount of "size_resource" in Gigabytes. For example "4g".

zone_count.description: Number of zones in which nodes will be placed.

apm.description: Instance configuration of the APM type.

deployment_template_id.description: ID of the deployment template this deployment is based off.

autoscale.description: Whether or not Elasticsearch autoscaling is enabled.

cloud_id.description: The cloud ID, an encoded string that provides other Elastic services with the necessary information to connect to this Elasticsearch and Kibana. See [Configure Beats and Logstash with Cloud ID](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/cloud/current/ec-cloud-id.html) for more information.

http_endpoint.description: HTTP endpoint for the Elasticsearch resource.

https_endpoint.description: HTTPS endpoint for the Elasticsearch resource.

ref_id.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for this Elasticsearch cluster.

max_size.description: Maximum size the tier can scale up to, e.g "64g".

max_size_resource.description: Resource type used when specifying the maximum size the tier can scale up to.

min_size.description: Minimum size the tier can scale down to when bidirectional autoscaling is supported.

min_size_resource.description: Resource type used when specifying the minimum size the tier can scale down to when bidirectional autoscaling is supported.

policy_override_json.description: An arbitrary JSON object overriding the default autoscaling policy. Don't set unless you really know what you are doing.

autoscaling.description: Optional Elasticsearch autoscaling settings, such a maximum and minimum size and resources.

instance_configuration_id.description: Controls the allocation of this topology element as well as allowed sizes and node_types. It needs to match the ID of an existing instance configuration.

node_roles.description: Defines the list of Elasticsearch node roles assigned to the topology element. This is supported from v7.10, and required from v8.

node_type_data.description: Defines whether this node can hold data (<8.0).

node_type_ingest.description: Defines whether this node can run an ingest pipeline (<8.0).

node_type_master.description: Defines whether this node can be elected master (<8.0).

node_type_ml.description: Defines whether this node can run ML jobs (<8.0).

size.description: Amount of "size_resource" per topology element in Gigabytes. For example "4g".

zone_count.description: Number of zones in which nodes will be placed.

elasticsearch.description: Instance configuration of the Elasticsearch Elasticsearch resource.

elasticsearch_cluster_ref_id.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for an Elasticsearch resource in this deployment.

http_endpoint.description: HTTP endpoint for the Enterprise Search resource.

https_endpoint.description: HTTPS endpoint for the Enterprise Search resource.

ref_id.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for this Enterprise Search resource.

status.description: Enterprise Search resource status (for example, "started", "stopped", etc).

instance_configuration_id.description: Controls the allocation of this topology element as well as allowed sizes and node_types. It needs to match the ID of an existing instance configuration.

node_type_appserver.description: Defines whether this instance should run as application/API server.

node_type_connector.description: Defines whether this instance should run as connector.

node_type_worker.description: Defines whether this instance should run as background worker.

size.description: Amount of "size_resource" in Gigabytes. For example "4g".

zone_count.description: Number of zones in which nodes will be placed.

enterprise_search.description: Instance configuration of the Enterprise Search type.

healthy.description: Overall health status of the deployment.

id.description: The unique ID of the deployment.

elasticsearch_cluster_ref_id.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for an Elasticsearch resource in this deployment.

http_endpoint.description: HTTP endpoint for the resource kind.

https_endpoint.description: HTTPS endpoint for the resource kind.

ref_id.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for this Integrations Server resource.

instance_configuration_id.description: Controls the allocation of this topology element as well as allowed sizes and node_types. It needs to match the ID of an existing instance configuration.

size.description: Amount of "size_resource" in Gigabytes. For example "4g".

zone_count.description: Number of zones in which nodes will be placed.

integrations_server.description: Instance configuration of the Integrations Server type.

elasticsearch_cluster_ref_id.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for an Elasticsearch resource in this deployment.

http_endpoint.description: HTTP endpoint for the Kibana resource.

https_endpoint.description: HTTPS endpoint for the Kibana resource.

ref_id.description: A locally-unique friendly alias for this Kibana resource.

instance_configuration_id.description: Controls the allocation of this topology element as well as allowed sizes and node_types. It needs to match the ID of an existing instance configuration.

size.description: Amount of size_resource in Gigabytes. For example "4g".

zone_count.description: Number of zones in which nodes will be placed.

kibana.description: Instance configuration of the Kibana type.

deployment_id.description: Destination deployment ID for the shipped logs and monitoring metrics.

logs.description: Defines whether logs are shipped to the destination deployment.

metrics.description: Defines whether metrics are shipped to the destination deployment.

ref_id.description: Elasticsearch resource kind ref_id of the destination deployment.

observability.description: Observability settings. Information about logs and metrics shipped to a dedicated deployment.

region.description: Region where the deployment is hosted.

tags.description: Key value map of arbitrary string tags.

traffic_filter.description: Traffic filter block, which contains a list of traffic filter rule identifiers.

block.description: Use this data source to retrieve information about an existing Elastic Cloud deployment.

deployment_template_id.description: Filter the result set by the ID of the deployment template the deployment is based off.

enterprise_search_resource_id.description: The Enterprise Search resource unique ID.

integrations_server_resource_id.description: The Integrations Server resource unique ID.

deployments.description: List of deployments which match the specified query.

healthy.description: Filter the result set by their health status.

id.description: Unique identifier of this data source.

name_prefix.description: Prefix to filter the returned deployment list by.

return_count.description: The number of deployments actually returned.

size.description: The maximum number of deployments to return. Defaults to `100`.

tags.description: Filter the result set by their assigned tags.

healthy.description: Overall health status of the resource instances.

status.description: Resource kind status. Can be one of `initializing`, `stopping`, `stopped`, `rebooting`, `restarting`.

block.description: Filter by APM resource kind status or configuration.

healthy.description: Overall health status of the resource instances.

status.description: Resource kind status. Can be one of `initializing`, `stopping`, `stopped`, `rebooting`, `restarting`.

block.description: Filter by Elasticsearch resource kind status or configuration.

healthy.description: Overall health status of the resource instances.

status.description: Resource kind status. Can be one of `initializing`, `stopping`, `stopped`, `rebooting`, `restarting`.

block.description: Filter by Enterprise Search resource kind status or configuration.

healthy.description: Overall health status of the resource instances.

status.description: Resource kind status. Can be one of `initializing`, `stopping`, `stopped`, `rebooting`, `restarting`.

block.description: Filter by Integrations Server resource kind status or configuration.

healthy.description: Overall health status of the resource instances.

status.description: Resource kind status. Can be one of `initializing`, `stopping`, `stopped`, `rebooting`, `restarting`.

block.description: Filter by Kibana resource kind status or configuration.
Use this data source to retrieve a list of IDs for the deployment and resource kinds, based on the specified query.

domain_name.description: The domain name to point towards the PSC endpoint.

region.description: Region to retrieve the Prive Link configuration for.

service_attachment_uri.description: The service attachment URI to attach the PSC endpoint to.

block.description: Use this data source to retrieve information about the GCP Private Service Connect configuration for a given region. Further documentation on how to establish a PrivateLink connection can be found in the ESS [documentation](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/cloud/current/ec-traffic-filtering-psc.html).

accessible.description: To have this version accessible/not accessible by the calling user. This is only relevant for Elasticsearch Service (ESS), not for ECE.

allowlisted.description: To include/not include this version in the `allowlist`. This is only relevant for Elasticsearch Service (ESS), not for ECE.

compatible_node_types.description: List of node types compatible with this one.

denylist.description: List of configuration options that cannot be overridden by user settings.

docker_image.description: Docker image to use for the APM instance.

apm.description: Information for APM workloads on this stack version.

compatible_node_types.description: List of node types compatible with this one.

denylist.description: List of configuration options that cannot be overridden by user settings.

docker_image.description: Docker image to use for the Elasticsearch cluster instances.

plugins.description: List of available plugins to be specified by users in Elasticsearch cluster instances.

elasticsearch.description: Information for Elasticsearch workloads on this stack version.

compatible_node_types.description: List of node types compatible with this one.

denylist.description: List of configuration options that cannot be overridden by user settings.

docker_image.description: Docker image to use for the Enterprise Search instance.

enterprise_search.description: Information for Enterprise Search workloads on this stack version.

id.description: Unique identifier of this data source.

compatible_node_types.description: List of node types compatible with this one.

denylist.description: List of configuration options that cannot be overridden by user settings.

docker_image.description: Docker image to use for the Kibana instance.

kibana.description: Information for Kibana workloads on this stack version.

lock.description: Lock the `latest` `version_regex` obtained, so that the new stack release doesn't cascade the changes down to the deployments. It can be changed at any time.

min_upgradable_from.description: The minimum stack version which can be upgraded to this stack version.

region.description: Region where the stack pack is. For Elastic Cloud Enterprise (ECE) installations, use `ece-region`.

upgradable_to.description: A list of stack versions which this stack version can be upgraded to.

version_regex.description: Regex to filter the available stacks. Can be any valid regex expression, when multiple stacks are matched through a regex, the latest version is returned. `latest` is also accepted to obtain the latest available stack version.

block.description:
Use this data source to retrieve information about an existing Elastic Cloud stack.

  -> **Note on regions** Before you start, you might want to check the [full list](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/cloud/current/ec-regions-templates-instances.html) of regions available in Elasticsearch Service (ESS).

id.description: The id of the traffic filter to select.

name.description: The exact name of the traffic filter to select.

region.description: Region where the traffic filter is. For Elastic Cloud Enterprise (ECE) installations, use `ece-region`

include_by_default.description: Should the ruleset be automatically included in the new deployments.

region.description: The ruleset can be attached only to deployments in the specific region.

source.description: Allowed traffic filter source: IP address, CIDR mask, or VPC endpoint ID.

block.description: Use this data source to filter for an existing traffic filter that has been created via one of the provided filters.
